1560245103_191qyhaRxXEx1bdtG65iQvFddtXBj.body:
The data is scraped from the JSON files (`data.json` in most cases) and put in a local read-only SQLite database, you can't update or delete rows and expect the changes to be delivered to your peers, you can only change the data for your peers if you or your users change the JSON files.

The JSON files are scraped according to the `dbschema.json` file, how it works in detail you have to dig the code base.

More info here:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1DocsYf2tZVVMEMJFHiDsppmFicZCWkVv1/site_development/dbschema_json/

Pull request to improve the ZeroNet documentation can be made here:

https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/Documentation

>free yourself from this all-masonic-desire to change the world.

What would be the goal of instilling the desire to "change the world" in others?
I think the core of the problem lies in the word itself, it is implied that change == good, and not changing == bad.
